get.description: This endpoint retrieves details of the authenticated user or a specific user in the system. It returns user data such as name, email, ID, and other relevant information

parameters.name: roleId
parameters.description:
The identifier for the role that generated by system. Use GET /roles API to get the list of Role IDs.
**Example:** `621dd813eb3ebf16b94d6969`

parameters.name: teamId
parameters.description:
The identifier for the team that generated by system. Use GET /teams API to get the list of Team IDs.
**Example:** `650151e4c8a55842604f1662`

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Description: Indicates the current status of a user account. When this key returns `Inactive` , it means that the user account has been registered for the first time but remains unverified. On the other hand, if the status is `Pending` , it means that the user has been invited to MileApp but has yet to complete the verification process. Finally, when the status is `Active` , it means that the user account is fully active, indicating that the user can access and utilize MileApp’s features.
**Example: ** `active`

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Fields is for selecting the specific fields that you can choose by multiples to show in the response using a string with a comma delimiter.
**Example:** `name,email,status`

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Dynamic value to search user based on username and full name

get.description: This endpoint returns details about the currently authenticated user. This is useful for applications where a user may need to view or update their own profile, check their roles, or verify their account status

hub.name: Bandung
hub.address: 11, Jalan Stasiun Barat, Bandung Kota 40181, Indonesia

patch.description: This endpoint allows you to update the details of a specific user in the system. and the data to be updated is provided in the request body

get.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve user details based on the provided email address. This is useful for systems that need to query user information directly using an email as the identifier, which is a common unique attribute across many systems

parameters.name: email
parameters.description:
The email of users who are already registered in each organization.
**Example** : `example@mile.app`

get.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve the details of a specific user using their unique user ID.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description:
Unique identifier for the vehicle that generated by system.
**Example** : `62ce3918d3f3e1681a3a54b2`

put.description: This endpoint allows you to update the details of a specific user in the system. The user ID is passed as a path parameter, and the data to be updated is provided in the request body

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The identifier for the user that generated by system. **Example:** `621dd813eb3ebf16b94d6969`

patch.description: This endpoint allows you to update the details of a specific user in the system. The user ID is passed as a path parameter, and the data to be updated is provided in the request body

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The identifier for the user that generated by system. **Example:** `621dd813eb3ebf16b94d6969`

get.description: This endpoint retrieves details of the specific authenticated user that can't login because locked by system

post.description: This endpoint for unlock the specific authenticated user that can't login because locked by system

example.message: user+1@mile.app has been unlocked. The user can now log in.

post.description: This endpoint for reset password of the specific authenticated user and Only the Owner role can reset the password for another Owner.

example.message: Your password has been updated successfully.
You cannot use a password that you have used before.
Data not found. Please check the ID/reference number and try again.

delete.description: This endpoint allows an authorized user (typically an admin) to delete a specific user from the system using their unique user ID. This action is permanent and cannot be undone, so it should be used with caution. The endpoint ensures that only authorized users with the necessary permissions can delete users.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The identifier for the user that generated by system. **Example:** `621dd813eb3ebf16b94d6969`

teamId.description:
The team id of user. If you set empty array, it will assigned to all team.
**Example**: `['621dd813eb3ebf16b94d6969','621dd813eb3ebf16b94d6968']`

password.description:
String that must contain lowercase, uppercase, number and symbols.
**Example**: `1QklJb@ap`
